properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 21 at 3:01PM ChST until January 27 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
properties.description:
...SURF BUILDING ALONG NORTHERN AND EASTERN SHORES THIS WEEK...

.BUILDING TRADE-WIND SWELL WILL CAUSE SURF TO INCREASE THROUGH
THE WEEK. ALSO...THE LARGE NORTH SWELL FROM A MID-PACIFIC STORM
THAT IS CREATING HAZARDOUS SURF ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS HAS BEEN
EXTENDED TO LAST THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY.

* WHAT...FOR THE HIGH SURF ADVISORY, LARGE BREAKING WAVES OF 7
TO 9 FEET. FOR THE HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS, DANGEROUS AND
FREQUENT RIP CURRENTS.

* WHERE...FOR THE HIGH SURF ADVISORY, ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS
OF THE MARIANAS. FOR THE HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS, ALONG
NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS OF THE MARIANAS.

* WHEN...FOR THE HIGH SURF ADVISORY, UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING. FOR
THE HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS, THROUGH NEXT SUNDAY
NIGHT...PRIMARILY ON THE EAST FACING REEFS AFTER WEDNESDAY.

* IMPACTS...DANGEROUS SWIMMING AND SURFING CONDITIONS AND
LOCALIZED BEACH EROSION. RIP CURRENTS CAN SWEEP EVEN THE BEST
SWIMMERS AWAY FROM SHORE INTO DEEPER WATER.
properties.instruction:
DO NOT VENTURE OUT NEAR THE REEF LINE...ESPECIALLY ALONG NORTH
AND EAST FACING REEFS. LARGE BREAKING WAVES CAN KNOCK YOU DOWN.
IF YOU BECOME CAUGHT IN A RIP CURRENT...YELL FOR HELP. REMAIN
CALM...DO NOT EXHAUST YOURSELF...STAY AFLOAT WHILE WAITING FOR
HELP. IF YOU HAVE TO SWIM OUT OF A RIP CURRENT...SWIM PARALLEL TO
SHORE AND BACK TOWARD THE BEACH WHEN POSSIBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO
SWIM DIRECTLY AGAINST A RIP CURRENT AS YOU WILL TIRE QUICKLY.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH LATE SUNDAY
